page.title: 14ECOLOGY OF HALWELL&MORELEIGH
page.content: For centuries in Halwell and Moreleigh farming,wildlife,people and transport have had to exist together,but in 1985 there is a growing awareness of problems connected with such aspects of rural life as: 1.Stubble burning-now much regulated and discouraged. 2.Silage and other pollution of rivers 3.Overuse of pesticides and herbicides 4.The uprooting of ancient hedges and trees. 5.Neglectful and wilful closure of footpaths and ancient rights of way. 6. The constant encroachment of the motor vehicle into every aspect of daily life-noise pollution being a particular worry. 7.Indiscriminate and unsuitable development on farm and green belt land.
